description: Strong bullish reversal pattern consisting of three troughs with the middle trough (head) being the lowest and two higher troughs (shoulders) on either side. Forms after a downtrend and signals potential trend reversal.
validationRules: Must form after a clear downtrend
Three distinct troughs with middle trough lowest
Left and right shoulders should be roughly equal in height
Neckline connects the peaks between the troughs
Volume should increase on the right shoulder and breakout
Breakout should occur above the neckline with strong volume
invalidationSignals: Price fails to break above neckline
Right shoulder falls below the head
Neckline has extreme downward slope (>15 degrees)
Pattern takes longer than 3 months to form (loses reliability)
commonMistakes: Ignoring volume - must increase on breakout
Not waiting for neckline retest after breakout
Misjudging the shoulders - they don't need to be perfect mirrors
Using pattern in ranging market instead of clear downtrend

tradeSetup.entry: Breakout above neckline with volume confirmation, or retest of neckline as support
tradeSetup.stopLoss: Below the right shoulder low or below the head for aggressive trades
tradeSetup.target: Measured move: distance from head to neckline projected upward from breakout point

supportive: RSI showing bullish divergence at the head
MACD bullish crossover during right shoulder formation
Volume spike on neckline breakout (1.5x+ average)
Moving averages starting to curl upward
conflicting: Major resistance level just above neckline
Bearish MACD crossover during right shoulder

confluenceFactors: Pattern forms at a significant support level
Aligns with round number support (psychological level)
Multiple timeframe confirmation (pattern visible on daily and weekly)
